args.natural_language_statement:
Translate the following and check correctness: Show that if G = H_1 × H_2 × ... × H_n is the internal direct product of normal subgroups H_1, H_2, ..., H_n, then for any i ≠ j we have: H_i ∩ H_j = {1}.
Save it to: srdoty_alg_products_363.lean

args.content:
import Mathlib


/-- Show that if G = H_1 × H_2 × ... × H_n is the internal direct product of normal subgroups H_1, H_2, ..., H_n, then for any i ≠ j we have: H_i ∩ H_j = {1}. -/
theorem of_normal_tac_2237 (G : Type u) [Group G] (H : ι → Subgroup G) (h : IsInternal H) (f : (i j : ι) → i ≠ j → H i ⊓ H j = ⊥) : ∀ (i j : ι), i ≠ j → H i ⊓ H j = ⊥ := sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

universe u v

variable {G : Type u} [Group G]
variable {ι : Type v}
variable (H : ι → Subgroup G) (h : IsInternal H)

/-- If G is the internal direct product of the subgroups H i, then for i ≠ j we have H i ⊓ H j = ⊥. -/
theorem intersection_trivial_of_internal_direct_product
  : ∀ {i j : ι}, i ≠ j → H i ⊓ H j = (⊥ : Subgroup G) := by
  intro i j hij
  sorry

/-- If G is the internal direct product of the subgroups H i, then for i ≠ j we have H i ⊓ H j = ⊥. -/
theorem intersection_trivial_of_internal_direct_product
  {i j : ι} (hij : i ≠ j) : H i ⊓ H j = (⊥ : Subgroup G) := by
  -- proof is omitted
  sorry
